bug.author: smokedsalmonbagel
bug.summary: Cannot build - subprocess has no attribute '_optim_args_from_interpreter_flags' on AWS EC2
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>My actions before raising this issue</denchmark-h>
Read/searched the docs Searched past issues
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behaviour</denchmark-h>
Following the guide for ubuntu 18 here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/cvat/blob/develop/cvat/apps/documentation/installation.md#ubuntu-1804-x86_64amd64>https://github.com/opencv/cvat/blob/develop/cvat/apps/documentation/installation.md#ubuntu-1804-x86_64amd64</denchmark-link>
Should work. It worked for me in the past. <denchmark-h:h3>Current Behaviour</denchmark-h>
When docker-compose build is run the build fails with <denchmark-code> Running setup.py install for python-ldap: finished with status 'error' ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: command: /usr/bin/python3 -u -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'/tmp/pip-install-lvt1ed69/python-ldap/setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'/tmp/pip-install-lvt1ed69/python-ldap/setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' install --record /tmp/pip-record-xk43i3o2/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile --install-headers /usr/local/include/python3.5/python-ldap cwd: /tmp/pip-install-lvt1ed69/python-ldap/ </denchmark-code>
and <denchmark-code> File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/setuptools/_distutils/command/install_lib.py", line 138, in byte_compile verbose=self.verbose, dry_run=self.dry_run) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/setuptools/_distutils/util.py", line 423, in byte_compile cmd.extend(subprocess._optim_args_from_interpreter_flags()) AttributeError: module 'subprocess' has no attribute '_optim_args_from_interpreter_flags' ---------------------------------------- ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: /usr/bin/python3 -u -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'/tmp/pip-install-lvt1ed69/python-ldap/setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'/tmp/pip-install-lvt1ed69/python-ldap/setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' install --record /tmp/pip-record-xk43i3o2/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile --install-headers /usr/local/include/python3.5/python-ldap Check the logs for full command output.
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Possible Solution</denchmark-h>
Not sure - maybe something with the python version since subprocess is standard. I am using 3.6.9 but also tried 3.7. Since this seems to fail on the first compile task I don't think it has to do with python-ldap itself. <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)</denchmark-h>
Use setup guide on AWS EC2 instance with Unbuntu 18 AMI (also tried ubuntu deep learning AMI)
<denchmark-h:h3>Context</denchmark-h>
Just trying to build on AWS EC2. <denchmark-h:h3>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Git hash commit 18f6b2f Docker version docker version 19.03.12 Are you using Docker Swarm or Kubernetes? no Operating System and version (e.g. Linux, Windows, MacOS): Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS Other diagnostic information / logs FULL LOG BELOW

comments.comment: Experiencing same issue and my environment is the same except I am doing it on a local machine.
Was able to fix by fixing setuptools to version 47.3.2 in the Dockerfile.

Was able to fix by fixing setuptools to version 47.3.2 in the Dockerfile.
Thanks! This worked for me as well.

Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tobymcclean>@tobymcclean</denchmark-link>
I have the same exact issue right now. Did you set the version of setuptools in Dockerfile manually? like this on line 59 of Dockerfile which is in Root CVAT directory <denchmark-code> python3 -m pip install --no-cache-dir -U pip==20.0.1 setuptools==47.3.2 && \ </denchmark-code>
Edit:- It's working. Thank You

Hello @tobymcclean I have the same exact issue right now. Did you set the version of setuptools in Dockerfile manually? like this on line 59 of Dockerfile which is in Root CVAT directory python3 -m pip install --no-cache-dir -U pip==20.0.1 setuptools==47.3.2 && \
Edit:- It's working. Thank You
I set it in the Dockerfile manually like you show here

Edit:- It's working. Thank You
